perturbation.original_text: FSL and AFSL may not exercise the Put Option prior to the Option Starting Date nor more than one hundred eighty (180) days after the Option Starting Date.
perturbation.changed_text: FSL and AFSL may not exercise the Put Option prior to the Option Starting Date nor more than thirty (30) days after the Option Starting Date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows 180 days for exercising the Put Option after the starting date. By reducing this to 30 days, we create a condition that may unreasonably restrict the option holder's ability to exercise their right within a timeframe that could be deemed insufficient or conflict with standards of commercial reasonableness, depending on the jurisdiction and specific circumstances.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with principles of 'reasonable time' in contract law, which is interpreted based on specific circumstances and jurisdictions.

perturbation.original_text: TPH-A and TPH may not exercise the Call Option prior to the Option Starting Date nor more than one hundred eighty (180) days after the Option Starting Date.
perturbation.changed_text: TPH-A and TPH may not exercise the Call Option prior to the Option Starting Date nor more than fifteen (15) days after the Option Starting Date.
perturbation.explanation: Similar to the Put Option change, reducing the Call Option exercise window to 15 days may be deemed unreasonably restrictive, potentially conflicting with principles of 'reasonable time' for contract execution. This short timeframe could be seen as coercively limiting the option holder's ability to assess and act on their rights effectively.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with principles of 'reasonable time' in contract law, which is interpreted based on specific circumstances and jurisdictions.

perturbation.original_text: If, after the Effective Date, TPH or TPH-A shall have materially breached any of its representations or warranties contained in this Agreement or shall have failed to comply in any material respect with any of the other covenants or agreements contained in this Agreement, which breach or failure shall not have been remedied within thirty (30) days after written notice thereof (the “Default Notice”) has been given by AFSL to TPH/TPH-A, then AFSL shall have the option of purchasing from TPH-A, and TPH-A shall be obligated to sell, all of the Shares then owned by TPH-A at a purchase price per Share equal to the lesser of: (i) the Net Book Value as of the most recent month end (provided that, if the Net Book Value is a negative amount, the product of the Net Book Value multiplied by such Sale Shares shall be deemed to be one Japanese Yen (¥1)), or (ii) the Shares Purchase Price, divided by the number of Sale Shares.
perturbation.changed_text: If, after the Effective Date, TPH or TPH-A shall have materially breached any of its representations or warranties contained in this Agreement or shall have failed to comply in any material respect with any of the other covenants or agreements contained in this Agreement, which breach or failure shall not have been remedied within ten (10) days after written notice thereof (the “Default Notice”) has been given by AFSL to TPH/TPH-A, then AFSL shall have the option of purchasing from TPH-A, and TPH-A shall be obligated to sell, all of the Shares then owned by TPH-A at a purchase price per Share equal to the lesser of: (i) the Net Book Value as of the most recent month end (provided that, if the Net Book Value is a negative amount, the product of the Net Book Value multiplied by such Sale Shares shall be deemed to be one Japanese Yen (¥1)), or (ii) the Shares Purchase Price, divided by the number of Sale Shares.
perturbation.explanation: By reducing the cure period for a material breach from 30 days to 10 days, this modification creates a situation where the breaching party has significantly less time to rectify the issue. This may be considered an unreasonably short timeframe, particularly for complex breaches that require substantial investigation or remediation efforts. Such a restriction might contradict the principle of good faith and fair dealing, and certain statutory protections related to curing contractual defaults depending on the applicable jurisdiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with principles of 'reasonable opportunity to cure' in contract law and statutory provisions related to notice and cure periods for contractual defaults.
